maml:description.maml:para: Remove one or all items from the data cache.
Removes a given item from the in-memory data cache, either by its name or ID, or clears the entire cache.

Reset Akamai PowerShell options.
Removes the Akamai PowerShell options JSON file located at either `~/.akamai-pwsh/options.json` or the location found in the `AkamaiOptionsPath` environment variable.
Validate Akamai credentials.
Checks whether each of the credential elements, `access_token`, `client_token`, `host`, and `client_secret`, is in the expected format.
The auth in a `PSCustomObject` to test.
The auth in a `PSCustomObject` to test.
Decode Base64.
Converts a Base64-encoded string to plain text.
A Base64-encoded string to decode.
A Base64-encoded string to decode.
Encode in Base64.
Converts a plain-text string to Base64 encoding.
A plain-text string to encode.
A plain-text string to encode.
Decorate Akamai errors.
Convertes JSON-formatted error data to PowerShell objects and updates the format of error records for easier troubleshooting.
An error record object to update.
Akamai options specified in a `PSCustomObject`.
An error record object to update.
Akamai options specified in a `PSCustomObject`.
Format file name.
URL-encodes various characters that can't be used in filenames on any of the supported platforms.
A file name to format.
A file name to format.
Format query string.
Performs various operations to sanitize a query string, mostly to url-encode spaces, and removes null query parameters from the string before signature calculation.
A query string to format.
A query string to format.
Calculate an EdgeGrid authorization header.
Calculates a valid EdgeGrid authorization header using the provided request details and API client credentials.
Akamai credentials specified in a `PSCustomObject`.

Retrieve Akamai credentials from session, disk, or environment variables.

Retrieves Akamai credentials from one of these sources: an existing session created with `New-AkamaiSession`, an `.edgerc` file, or from environment variables. The search for credentials follows a priority order. If a valid session is found that contains the requested credentials section (defaulting to `default`), that session is returned. If the required data isn't available in the session, the function checks environment variables, followed by an `.edgerc` file. Multiple credentials may exist in each source, depending on the specified section. See the Authentication (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/authentication)guide for details.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Get Akamai Options.
Returns a global `AkamaiOptions` variable. If the variable doesn't exist, the function creates it.
Get an Akamai session.
Returns an `AkamaiSession` variable.
Create a User-Agent for requests.
Collates the necessary details from the module version and OS to create a unique User-Agent string sent along with all requests. Used to track version and platform usage in API logs.
Get API client authorization grants.
Returns information about the Akamai API client, including the APIs that the client is authorized to access.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Output API response body as a PSCustomObject.

Convert a `-Body` parameter to a `PSCustomObject`.
Use this function for various endpoints that require body manipulation. It takes a `-Body` parameter as either a hashtable or string and converts it to a `PSCustomObject`.
The request body, either as a `PSCustomObject`, hashtable, or string.
The request body, either as a `PSCustomObject`, hashtable, or string.
Encrypt message with HMACSHA256.
Takes a message string and secret and returns HMACSHA256-hashed ciphertext. Used in EdgeGrid authorization header calculation.
The secret key for encryption.

Send an authorized HTTPS request to an Akamai RESTful web service.

Constructs a call to `Invoke-WebRequest` from the given `-Path`, `-Method`, and other additional parameters and adds necessary authorization details retrieved from `Get-AkamaiCredentials`. The response is formatted into a `PSCustomObject` including `Status`, a hashtable of headers, and a `PSCustomObject` of the response body. Error handling is configured based on the current `AkamaiOptions` variable.
Your request path.
The request method.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
The query parameters in a hashtable.
An additional headers in a hashtable.
The request body to include in the auth calculation.
An input file to be read as part of the auth calculation.
The file to write response data to.
The maximum size of the body parameter. Defaults to `128KB`.
The retry index. Used to determine whether a failed request should be retried.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
When the switch parameter is present, this ignores HTTP error statuses and continues to process responses. The error responses are written to the pipeline just as if they were successful.
> Note: This parameter is only applicable with PowerShell 7+.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

Create a default data cache object.
Creates a `PSCustomObject` of a given format and assigns it to a globally-scoped variable. This variable holds the in-memory data cache if this feature is enabled.
Populate Akamai options.

Creates a new `PSCustomObject` of the supported options and writes that object to a disk, either at the default location of `~/.akamai-pwsh/options.json` or to a location specified in the `AkamaiOptionsPath` environment variable.
Create an Akamai authorization session.
Creates a `PSCustomObject` holding the provided authorization parameters to be re-used by any request to `Invoke-AkamaiRestMethod` or `Invoke-AkamaiRequest`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

The API credential's client token.
The session environment. Similar to the use of the `-Section` parameter in an `.edgerc` file.
The API credential's hostname.

When the switch parameter is present, the function returns session data.

Create an Edge auth token.

Various Akamai services make use of Token Authentication or similar services, which require encrypted tokens. This function will create such a token from the given inputs for you to use in testing or live requests.
An `acl` element to include in the edge auth token.
An algorithm to use in calculating the edge auth token signature. Defaults to `sha256` but also accepts `sha1` and `md5`.
The `data` element to include in the edge auth token.
the field delimiter. Defaults to `~`.
The token duration in hours. During token generation, it's converted to seconds.
The token duration in minutes. During token generation, it's converted to seconds.
The token duration in seconds.
The token end time in epoch format.
When the switch parameter is present, it forces a URL token element to be URL-encoded.
The `id` element to include in the edge auth token.
The `ip` element to include in the edge auth token.
The `salt` element to include in the edge auth token.
The secret key for encryption.
The token start time in epoch format.

Remove a session.
Removes an in-memory authorization session.
Add to or update the Data Cache.

Creates or updates elements in the in-memory Akamai data cache, such as properties, AppSec configurations, and more, and is called by various sub-module functions automatically when elements included in the cache scope are retrieved from the Akamai APIs.

Update Akamai Options.

Updates any of the supported Akamai options, either as booleans to enable or disable certain features, for example, `-EnableErrorRetried $true`, or as integers to set various thresholds and limits, for example, `-MaxErrorRetries 2`. You can also reset all options to their defaults with `-RestoreDefaults`.
> Note: You can't set any options and restore the others to default in a single command. You need to restore the defaults first, then set whatever options you wish.
Forces the addition of a header disabling prefixes in all Property API calls, regardless of API client setting.
Enables the in-memory data cache feature, which caches resolution of names to IDs and speeds up subsequent API calls.
Enables retries for applicable requests when the API endpoint responds with a 5XX status code.
Enables retries for applicable requests when the API endpoint responds with a 429 status code.

Enables outputting a warning when you have reached a set percentage of your rate limit, e.g. if the limit is 500 requests, your warning percentage is 80 and you have expended 400 requests, any further requests before the rate limit repleneshes will result in a warning being printed to the shell.

Enables the recommended actions provider, which will suggest actions in the event of certain errors. This feature requires the use of the `PSFeedbackProvider` Powershell experimental feature, and currently has an extremely limited scope.
Set the initial wait time (in seconds) after which PowerShell will retry an applicable request.
Set the maximum number of retries which will be attempted for applicable requests in the event of an error.
Set the percentage used of the rate limit for a given endpoint, above which PowerShell will warn you of rate limit exhaustion.
Restore Akamai options to the default values.
Forces the addition of a header disabling prefixes in all Property API calls, regardless of API client setting.
Enables the in-memory data cache feature, which caches resolution of names to IDs and speeds up subsequent API calls.
Enables retries for applicable requests when the API endpoint responds with a 5XX status code.
Enables retries for applicable requests when the API endpoint responds with a 429 status code.

Enables outputting a warning when you have reached a set percentage of your rate limit, e.g. if the limit is 500 requests, your warning percentage is 80 and you have expended 400 requests, any further requests before the rate limit repleneshes will result in a warning being printed to the shell.

Enables the recommended actions provider, which will suggest actions in the event of certain errors. This feature requires the use of the `PSFeedbackProvider` Powershell experimental feature, and currently has an extremely limited scope.
Set the initial wait time (in seconds) after which PowerShell will retry an applicable request.
Set the maximum number of retries which will be attempted for applicable requests in the event of an error.
Set the percentage used of the rate limit for a given endpoint, above which PowerShell will warn you of rate limit exhaustion.
Restore Akamai options to the default values.

Test an Akamai endpoint.
This function is a simple wrapper to `Invoke-AkamaiRestMethod` with fewer options. It provides a more simplified way of testing API endpoints.

Remove one or more versions of Akamai PowerShell modules.

Uninstalls one or more versions of the Akamai PowerShell module(s). Use it primarily to clean up version 1.x installations that aren't automatically upgraded when installing version 2. You can use this function to remove a specific version, uninstall all versions, remove all installed instances of version 1, or delete all versions except for the latest version of both v1 and v2 simultaneously.
Remove all versions of Akamai PowerShell from all applicable locations.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
By default, this funtion will inspect all folders in your PSModulePath environmen variable. Add this option if you would like to apply the removals to a specific directory.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Remove all but the latest installed version of Akamai PowerShell. This will also include the V1 AkamaiPowershell module.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
By default, this funtion will inspect all folders in your PSModulePath environmen variable. Add this option if you would like to apply the removals to a specific directory.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Remove all versions of the monolithic Akamai Powershell (v1) module. Any installed modules of version 2.0 or above will not be affected.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
By default, this funtion will inspect all folders in your PSModulePath environmen variable. Add this option if you would like to apply the removals to a specific directory.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
By default, this funtion will inspect all folders in your PSModulePath environmen variable. Add this option if you would like to apply the removals to a specific directory.

Remove any installed Akamai modules matching a given version string. Note: if you only specify the major and minor versions, e.g. 2.0, all patch version numbers will also be removed, e.g. 2.0.1, 2.0.2 etc. The same applies if you only supply a major version, any matching minor or patch versions will be removed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Remove all versions of Akamai PowerShell from all applicable locations.
Remove all but the latest installed version of Akamai PowerShell. This will also include the V1 AkamaiPowershell module.
Remove all versions of the monolithic Akamai Powershell (v1) module. Any installed modules of version 2.0 or above will not be affected.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
By default, this funtion will inspect all folders in your PSModulePath environmen variable. Add this option if you would like to apply the removals to a specific directory.

Remove any installed Akamai modules matching a given version string. Note: if you only specify the major and minor versions, e.g. 2.0, all patch version numbers will also be removed, e.g. 2.0.1, 2.0.2 etc. The same applies if you only supply a major version, any matching minor or patch versions will be removed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
